intro: Sullivania minor, commonly known as the small sullivania, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Sullivania minor is an important species for ecological studies due to its role in supporting local pollinators.
